1.text: Woe to those who devise iniquity and plot evil on their beds! At morning’s light they accomplish it because the power is in their hands.

2.text: They covet fields and seize them; they take away houses. They deprive a man of his home, a fellow man of his inheritance.

3.text: Therefore this is what the LORD says: “I am planning against this nation a disaster from which you cannot free your necks. Then you will not walk so proudly, for it will be a time of calamity.

4.text: In that day they will take up a proverb against you and taunt you with this bitter lamentation: ‘We are utterly ruined! He has changed the portion of my people. How He has removed it from me! He has allotted our fields to traitors.’”

5.text: Therefore, you will have no one in the assembly of the LORD to divide the land by lot.

6.text: “Do not preach,” they preach. “Do not preach these things; disgrace will not overtake us.”

7.text: Should it be said, O house of Jacob, “Is the Spirit of the LORD impatient? Are these the things He does?” Do not My words bring good to him who walks uprightly?

8.text: But of late My people have risen up like an enemy: You strip off the splendid robe from unsuspecting passersby like men returning from battle.

9.text: You drive the women of My people from their pleasant homes. You take away My blessing from their children forever.

10.text: Arise and depart, for this is not your place of rest, because its defilement brings destruction—a grievous destruction!

11.text: If a man of wind were to come and say falsely, “I will preach to you of wine and strong drink,” he would be just the preacher for this people!

12.text: I will surely gather all of you, O Jacob; I will collect the remnant of Israel. I will bring them together like sheep in a pen, like a flock in the midst of its pasture—a noisy throng.

13.text: One who breaks open the way will go up before them; they will break through the gate, and go out by it. Their King will pass through before them, the LORD as their leader.
